body: Well, turns out you were doing something wrong. The cameraType starts at 0 and not 1. You need to update the value list component in your script to 0, 1, and 2. It's currently 1, 2 and 3. In your file, you were setting up a parallel run which is quite picky for vertical views. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/7AULtQmLSn0XAgu15PtlleGZIyyEfAHedUjm5IaTt0bblIaxjpIZV-n3TNCZDF7MwbFZdxgYqST5SRVKnNtZsOcIVSA1Hg4V/ValueList.PNG) Still, we need to add a log to init component to give a more meaningful error message. Finally, you need to pick higher values for -ar and lower values for -aa for your analysis. It's not only about the number of bounces. Check pages 26 and 27 from [this tutorial](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/16228160/Daysim3.0.Tutorial.pdf). Cheers, Mostapha
